proof:
Proof. Let $P := \{v \in V : \deg(v) \leq b\}$. Then, $Q := V \setminus P$. This is clearly a partition, since each vertex is in exactly one of $P$ or $Q$.

We will now prove the bound on $G[P]$. For every vertex $v \in P$, $\deg(v) \leq b$ in $G$. Since $G[P]$ is a subgraph of $G$, $\deg(v) \leq b$ in $G[P]$ as well. Hence, $\Delta(G[P]) \leq b$.

Now for the bound on $|Q|$. By definition of $Q$, every vertex $v \in Q$ has $\deg(v) > b$. The degree of a vertex in the induced subgraph $G[Q]$ must be equal to its degree in the full graph $G$, so we have $\deg_{G[Q]}(v) > b$ for all $v \in Q$. The number of edges in $G[Q]$ is thus
$$ |E(G[Q])| = \frac{1}{2} \sum_{v \in Q} \deg_{G[Q]}(v) > \frac{1}{2} \sum_{v \in Q} b = \frac{1}{2} |Q| \cdot b. $$
Since $G[Q]$ is a subgraph of $G$, we have $|E(G[Q])| \leq m$. Combining these gives $m > \frac{1}{2} |Q| \cdot b$, and we rearrange to get $|Q| < \frac{2m}{b}$.
